location.merchant_description_html: Pemberton Farms is an anomaly on the city market circuit. How does it differ from other grocers? Take a look at my shopping cart! A bundle of juicy red apples, hand picked from a local farm. A 6-pack of beer, brewed on the North Shore. Ariston Olive Oil, which comes in a refill-able keg. A whole honey-glazed Ham that can feed 10. A rare cut of Portuguese cheese, a perfect platter centerpiece. Even a beautiful, potted bloom for my room. This is how every grocery cart should look: fresh. colorful. unique.

Holding down the farm in Reading Terminal Market, The Rib Stand brings you the juiciest ribs you’ll ever taste. If gnawing the meat off the bone is your style, order baby back or spare ribs. Want a jam-packed sandwich filled with tender rib meat? Rib sandwich for you! Pick a sauce to fit your favorite flavor: mild for the meek and hot for a kick! Then add on crispy potato wedges dusted in spices on the side. The Rib Stand is filling up your plate with mouthwatering meats that you’ll never get enough of!

Yikes! I gotta make it to class in 15, but I’m starved. Pizza Mercato makes my life easier. I can run in on my dash to class and get quick, friendly service. Ranging from $2.25 to $4.75, their slices always deliver. If I need a bigger bite, the Spaghetti Pizza takes tradition to a whole new delicious level. Whether I’m feeling Calzones, a Hero or Lasagna, Mercato’s my man. I order and a few minutes later, I’m walking into class while devouring a Neopolitan slice that puts a smile (and sauce) on my face.

Georgio’s Pizzeria brings a warm heartbeat to Manhattan’s Financial District. Escape the confines of your office to indulge in the homemade comfort of tempting Baked Ziti. If you love that, you’ll lose your mind over the fan favorite: Penne a la Vodka Pizza. Stop by Battery Park to enjoy the view of the Statue of Liberty as you nosh on your designer slice. Fitting, isn’t it? A glimpse of the woman that welcomed the great Italian tradition that makes Georgio’s what it is. Thanks Lady Liberty, we owe ya.

You know a bagel place is good when their Yelp page is stocked with desperate pleas for expansion. So...what keeps people obsessively clamoring for the recipe at Bergen Bagels? 1: The taste. Bagels seal in a signature flavor when they’re baked fresh on-premises in large kettles. 2: The toppings. Each bagel biter can choose to dress their bagel with a spread from the list of cream cheeses (23 to be exact), deli meats or fresh fish! The combinations are endless. Don’t be ashamed to double down: Whole Wheat Everything with Basil Cream Cheese for breakfast. Turkey BLT on a Salt Bagel for lunch!

I picked a bad time to fight with my sister. Sure, I’m mad she ate my Chips & Guacamole from 360 Gourmet Burritos, but I forgot she still HAS my burrito. In her right hand is my delicious Garlic Lime Chicken Burrito and in the other is her 360 Gourmet piled with chicken, steak and jalapeno-garlic. We’re locked in a stare-down. I make my move. I slap her right hand up so my prize goes flying. I jump, complete a 360 degree triple sow-cow twist flip and land, burrito in-hand. A perfect 10!

This year I’m petitioning to have the Oscar’s in San Francisco. Why? Because the food at Frjtz is a red carpet winner. The twice-fried Frjtz fry, dressed in designer Dipping Sauces like Spicy Yogurt Peanut and Roasted Pepper Mayo, outshines any celebrity. Sweet and Savory Crepes will dazzle the crowd. And fresh, steamed Belgian Mussels will have everyone talking for months. Frjtz is a winner in every category!

Imagine a restaurant that refuses to bestow any food but the best to its customers. One that has not 1, but 8 Manhattan locations. One that pairs quality ingredients with signature spices to create masterpieces like freshly baked pitas filled with salad and hummus. One that piles Falafel, Kebabs or Shawarma onto a platter, and crafts homemade hummus just for you. One where Honey Cake or Baklava top your best meal yet. This is Chickpea, expertly cooking better cuisine that is “Always Baked. Never Fried.”

This is Chickpea, expertly cooking better cuisine that is “Always Baked. Never Fried.”
location.merchant_name: Chickpea (LIRR Concourse Level Near A/C/E lines)

This is Chickpea, expertly cooking better cuisine that is “Always Baked. Never Fried.”

Julie and I went to Craig’s Cafe for lunch. While I indulged in a Chicken Finger Wrap and a thick chocolate Frappe, she enjoyed a Buffalo Chicken Salad. Then, the waitress delivered an Egg Croissant Sandwich to the table over. Isn’t it lunch time? What’s going on here? The waitress saw me staring. “We serve breakfast all day, you didn’t know?” NO! Don’t you think I would’ve ordered a Make-Your-Own-Omelet or jammed on Blueberry Pancakes by now?! I grabbed Julie’s hand tight. “We’re coming back tomorrow.”

Tune in to your roots at this Bed-Stuy coffee shop. Amidst a wood paneled backdrop, super chill staff crank out coffee orders to the tune of Brooklyn’s Finest and Black Coffee Shop Pandora stations on the free wi-fi. It’s the perfect spot to find a table, bust out the MacBook and zone out in your work for hours. When mad hunger strikes, sandwiches with chipotle sauce are a must. Go for the Roasted Turkey or the BLT with avocado. But on the real, everything at Colador’s odee good.

It’s a pizza pandemic! Cybelle’s Pizza is crawling with tasty food that’s trying to find a way into my stomach. A cheesy Monster Slice the size of Texas approaches. Clambake Pizza infested with basil and garlic emerges hot from the oven. It’s all delicious, really, but I’m already full from Happy Hour specials! Beer for $2.75 and half-price apps demolished my hunger. Other diners chuckle in their seats. No one turns down affordable, delicious eats and gets away with it. *Cue slasher music.*

Sneak into Seattle Cafe, the Upper East Side’s best-kept secret. Don’t be seen sipping a steaming Caramel Macchiato, or holding Hearty Oatmeal overflowing with filling fruits. Tiptoe in for lunch and your favorite Toasted Monte Cristo Panini piled with ham, smoked turkey, double cheese and the fixings. Stealthily dart in post-workout for a Caribbean Craze smoothie, carefully crafted with 10 flavorful juices. Beware. If you’re noticed, the Manhattan millions will come. And Seattle’s too good to share.

When Pigs Fly Bakery drops a remix on basic billowing bread loaves with their creative carb concoctions. I can hear it now: this little piggy got Brown Sugar Cinnamon Swirl Bread, this little piggy got Sun-Dried Tomato. This little piggy got Potato, Garlic and Onion, and this little piggy got a Chocolate Loaf. Classic breads like Tuscan Wheat sit alongside artisan choices like the Strawberry Banana Brown Sugar Loaf. Try out flavors via dollops of dough at the tasting table, but beware of indecision!

I entered Old Towne with one purpose: to snag two Lebanese Special pizzas from Drexel’s 09-10 winner for “Best Pizza.” The chefs expertly pair affordability with chopped steak, tomatoes and peppers atop a pie simmering in white garlic sauce. My quest was simple... but then I saw it. Sanna’s Middle Eastern cuisine; Old Towne’s other half. Pizza and wings meets Lamb Shawarma with Tabouli on the side? I had to nab a Falafel-stuffed Pita before I left with my pizzas. Okay… Baklava too. #MissionComplete.

We have exciting news: Chris Harris has got your cover....covered! Glamlife Thursdays. Epic Saturdays. Hot Mess Sundays. Though you may not know it, all of the fabulous gay nightlife events are brought to you by Chris Harris Presents! Pay with LevelUp at the door and you’ll get $10 worth of your cover charge paid for. Continue to pay with LevelUp every time you attend a Chris Harris Presents event and you can earn additional cover-free nights! Hit Liquor Store (25 Boylston Place) for Glamlife Thursdays, Guilt Nightclub (75 Warrenton Street) for "Queer" Fridays, The House of Blues (15 Lansdowne Street) for Epic Saturdays or Underbar (275 Tremont Street) for Hot Mess Sundays!

The largest sandwich in the Boston area has been spotted on the Common at Lambert’s Marketplace. We were first tipped off to the hot deli when we saw herds of deliriously happy diners exiting the scene during lunch, doggy bags in hand. The effects called for further investigation. According to our snacking sources, customers waited in line referring to the made-to-order goods by number or by a Boston street codename. The #4 AKA Summer Street is a killer combo of roast beef and drool-worthy horseradish that seemed to be a crowd favorite. Scope out the scene and report back?

I go to Sasha’s Coffee in my trench coat, fedora over my eyes. I must unearth their suspiciously delicious secrets. Last year the NY Times named Sasha’s on its “Top Ten Best Espressos” list. I spot a top-of-the-line Victoria Arduno espresso machine. A-ha! I pick up a menu: pastries from Balthazar Bakery! Quickly, I roll behind the counter. I see coffees like Homestead and Plowshares, brewed for small batch premium roasts. A barista yelps. Caught! But hey, I’m in a prime position for a great cup of coffee.

Blue Haven’s Irish pub heightens the senses every night. The shiny sight of 14 HD TVs. The aged flavor of beer paired with the cheesiest of Nachos. The smoothness of the marble bar. It’s sports and beer at its finest. What could possibly top a night in this pub mecca? Only brunch. Choices like the Irish Breakfast Burger with blood sausage or savory Chicken and Biscuits never disappoint. Brunch includes a free cocktail, so from PM to AM, you’ve come full circle. Hold your Mimosas high! Here’s to the Haven!

The minute I walked into O’Neals Pub, I was done for. HD TVs in every direction! NFL playing on the screens! Rare Irish Whiskeys. 19+ beers on draught. You can even take 6-packs to go. Then it got worse. I ordered. The Shepherds Pie came steaming with fresh mashed potatoes and cheddar jack piled on top. Only $7? I’ll order the Famous Irish Beef Stew, too. I settled into my food and brews for the long haul. O’Neals, you’ve been the most beloved Irish sports bar for 30 years, and I’m never leaving.

A hungry young professional is stopped in his tracks by the scent of seasoned tomato sauce and the sounds of a bustling crowd. “What on earth is Viga?” A man exiting, blissfully eating a fresh-baked roll chuckles. Walking inside, our entrepre-hero is floored by the operation. Fresh Salads are furiously being mixed in one line. Specialty Sandwiches are being wrapped and tossed “fish-market style” in another. Steaming heaps of Pasta are unloaded into cartons and sizzling Pizzas fly out of the oven every 5 mins. “This is insanely efficient,” biz boy notes as he dumps his McStalewich and hops in line for a more in-Viga-rating lunch.

Aceituna is THE place to get gourmet Mediterranean in Kendall! Don’t let the crowd shoo you away. The speedy lunch line also serves as a grand ingredient tour. First stop? The mesmerizing Shawarma racks. Juicy meat rotates as lunch-goers stare longingly and contemplate the delicious decision, “chicken or beef?” Next, you catch a glimpse of the Greek Salad, deliciously outfitted with glowing peppers, ripe tomatoes and feta. The sides are gorgeously displayed at the end of the route. Utilize your I-want-that finger point and proceed to your final destination: post-lunch satisfaction.

The “best city” battle rages at Big Guy’s Cafe & Grill. It’s surprisingly common to see true Bostonians cheering other teams. A Saratoga Springs slice hosts melted goat cheese over sundried tomatoes, and spinach. The Kansas City with sausage, pepperoni and bacon reps the Midwest. Don’t fret: the Boston slice stands strong with a combo of fresh mozz, tomato and pesto. If you refuse to pledge allegiance, Big Guy’s also serves gourmet subs, monster salads and breakfast all day. Every choice is a winning one.

Balducci’s, you can’t see me, but I’m giving you a standing ovation. Let’s back track. Earlier today, I picked up your Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and coated my desk, computer and valuable office supplies in a layer of paper towels (I’m an aggressive eater.) As I unwrapped my juicy lunch, the buffalo sauce cut through the air. A promising sign! I took my first bite. The bread provided a sturdy pocket for the crisp lettuce, ripe tomato and bleu cheese. My already satisfied taste buds were shocked by the star of the sandwich: the breaded chicken. This well-received sammy will be upgraded to colossal size next week.

People are attracted to the glowing orange sign out front like flies to those bug zapping lights: wide-eyed and hungry. But wait! Before you enter Hummus, you must have your teleportation hat on. One bite (nay, one whiff) of the smooth, garlic-y hummus or the smoky spiced lamb kabob, and you somehow wind up in the heart of Tel-Aviv, dining with locals on the Mediterranean coastline. When you leave, try and bring back some more hummus for us, pretty please?

“Hey Josh!” Josh is our favorite banker. He’s known the family who owns the place since they opened 10 years ago! He needs rich, strong coffee for his morning meetings. He’s always gets his joe-to-go with a bagel. “Morning, Sara!” Sara, on the other hand is a lounge-er. She initially came for the sunny, communal vibe...but she stayed for the Huevos Rancheros! Sara is a frequent victim of food envy and always tries to change her order last-minute. She’s a spicy one... “So, how about you? I don’t think we’ve met. I’m Cafe La Taza.”
